item.title: De Morgan's Laws
item.description: [!abstract] Theorem. Let $\lbrace A_i \rbrace$ be a collection of events. Then $$\left(\bigcup_i A_i\right)^c = \bigcap_i A_i^c \quad\text{and}\quad\left(\bigcap_i A_i\right)^c = \bigcup_i A_i^c.

item.title: Event
item.description: [!abstract] Definition. An event is any subset of outcomes; that is, any subset of the sample space $\Omega$. Let $\lbrace A_i \rbrace$ be a collection of events.

item.title: Sample Space
item.description: [!abstract] Definition. The set $\Omega$ of all possible outcomes of an experiment or random trial is called the sample space.
